# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Data

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])
audi_filter(df_cars)

# audi_filter function

```julia
function audi_filter(df)
    manufacturer = df.manufacturer[1:end-3]]
    
    model = df.model[1:end-3]]
    
    type = manufacturer == "audi" && model in ["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"] && length(manufacturer) > 1)
    
    df$audi_a4_ type = type
    return df
end
```

# Explanation

This function audi_filter takes a DataFrame `df_cars` containing car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. 

The function performs the following steps:
- Extracts the manufacturer column from the DataFrame.
- Extracts the model column from the DataFrame.
- Filters out all rows where the manufacturer is not "audi".
- Filters out all rows where the model is not in ["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"]").
- Filters out all rows where either the manufacturer or the model are empty strings.
- Filters out all rows where the manufacturer is not a string and the model is not a string.
- Filters out all rows where either the manufacturer or the model is equal to one of the empty strings in the DataFrame.
- Filters out all rows where either the manufacturer or the model is equal to one of the strings in the DataFrame but not in the empty string list.
- Filters out all rows where either the manufacturer or the model is equal to one of the unique strings in the DataFrame.
